issue.title: `prepare` script executed after injection when `shared-workspace-lockfile` is disabled
issue.body:
### Verify latest release

- [x] I verified that the issue exists in the latest pnpm release

### pnpm version

`8.6.12`

### Which area(s) of pnpm are affected? (leave empty if unsure)

_No response_

### Link to the code that reproduces this issue or a replay of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-qcx6vc?file=.npmrc

### Reproduction steps

Move to package a:
```sh
cd packages/a
```
Run the installation script
```sh
pnpm install
```
Check the resulting files in `node_modules`
```sh
cd node_modules/@test/b && ls
```
The installation is successful if `test.txt` is present.

### Describe the Bug

When executing `pnpm install` in package `@test/a` that depends (and injects) `@test/b`, the `prepare` step is executed after the injection, resulting in not seeing the effect in `node_modules`. Of course if the installation is run twice, the prepared files are present, because they are the ones of the previous execution on `prepare`.

### Expected Behavior

If the same steps are followed when `shared-workspace-lockfile=true`, the `prepare` script is correctly executed BEFORE the package is copied. That behaviour aligns with 1) the idea that dependencies preparation should happen before their installation in the current package, 2) the intuition that it makes no sense to prepare a folder that will not be considered by the current installation process.
I believe such behaviour should be the same regardless of the configuration of `shared-workspace-lockfile`.

### Which Node.js version are you using?

lts/hydrogen

### Which operating systems have you used?

- [X] macOS
- [ ] Windows
- [X] Linux

### If your OS is a Linux based, which one it is? (Include the version if relevant)

_No response_

comment.body: Okay. So I found out that I wasn't able to reproduce the bug because I forgot to remove `test.txt`. But now that I have confirm it, I think you should change the title of the issue to reflects the fact that `cd`ing to a workspace package is necessary for it to happen.

issue.title: `prepare` script executed after injection when `shared-workspace-lockfile` is disabled
issue.body:
### Verify latest release

- [x] I verified that the issue exists in the latest pnpm release

### pnpm version

`8.6.12`

### Which area(s) of pnpm are affected? (leave empty if unsure)

_No response_

### Link to the code that reproduces this issue or a replay of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-qcx6vc?file=.npmrc

### Reproduction steps

Move to package a:
```sh
cd packages/a
```
Run the installation script
```sh
pnpm install
```
Check the resulting files in `node_modules`
```sh
cd node_modules/@test/b && ls
```
The installation is successful if `test.txt` is present.

### Describe the Bug

When executing `pnpm install` in package `@test/a` that depends (and injects) `@test/b`, the `prepare` step is executed after the injection, resulting in not seeing the effect in `node_modules`. Of course if the installation is run twice, the prepared files are present, because they are the ones of the previous execution on `prepare`.

### Expected Behavior

If the same steps are followed when `shared-workspace-lockfile=true`, the `prepare` script is correctly executed BEFORE the package is copied. That behaviour aligns with 1) the idea that dependencies preparation should happen before their installation in the current package, 2) the intuition that it makes no sense to prepare a folder that will not be considered by the current installation process.
I believe such behaviour should be the same regardless of the configuration of `shared-workspace-lockfile`.

### Which Node.js version are you using?

lts/hydrogen

### Which operating systems have you used?

- [X] macOS
- [ ] Windows
- [X] Linux

### If your OS is a Linux based, which one it is? (Include the version if relevant)

_No response_

comment.body:
> Same behavior. `b` is symlinked:

> Nice! So it got worse 😅

Actually, it is actually the right behavior. `@test/b` is symlinked, but it is symlinked **to the virtual store** (`node_modules/.pnpm`), not the workspace package. And `@test/b` in the virtual store are actual files (hardlinks or reflinks).

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -354,3 +354,78 @@ test('interactively update should ignore dependencies from the ignoreDependencie
     expect(lockfile.packages['/is-positive@2.0.0']).toBeTruthy()
   }
 })
+
+test('interactively update should update corepack config', async () => {
+  prepare({
+    name: 'project-1',
+    packageManager: 'pnpm@8.7.0',
+  })
+
+  const storeDir = path.resolve('pnpm-store')
+
+  const headerChoice = {
+    name: 'Package                                                    Current   Target            URL ',
+    disabled: true,
+    hint: '',
+    value: '',
+  }
+
+  await add.handler(
+    {
+      ...DEFAULT_OPTIONS,
+      cacheDir: path.resolve('cache'),
+      dir: process.cwd(),
+      linkWorkspacePackages: true,
+      save: false,
+      storeDir,
+    },
+    ['pnpm@8.9.2']
+  )
+
+  prompt.mockResolvedValue({
+    updateDependencies: [
+      {
+        value: 'pnpm',
+        name: chalk`pnpm 8.7.0 ❯ 8.9.2 https://pnpm.io/ `,
+      },
+    ],
+  })
+
+  prompt.mockClear()
+  // t.comment('update to compatible versions')
+  await update.handler({
+    ...DEFAULT_OPTIONS,
+    cacheDir: path.resolve('cache'),
+    dir: process.cwd(),
+    interactive: true,
+    linkWorkspacePackages: true,
+    storeDir,
+  })
+
+  expect(prompt.mock.calls[0][0].choices).toStrictEqual([
+    {
+      choices: [
+        headerChoice,
+        {
+          message: chalk`pnpm                                                         8.7.0 ❯ 8.9.2                 `,

issue.title: SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'
issue.body:
### Code to reproduce the issue:
https://github.com/andresgutgon/nx-with-pnpm-unexpected-export
I don't see errors in my `node_modules/.pnpm-debug.log`

### Expected behavior:
Switching to `yarn` the tests run even when Remix is a dependency.

### Actual behavior:
When running test in a package with Jest:
```
$ nx test foolib --verbose
```
I get this error:
```
/Users/me/code/unexpected-export/node_modules/.pnpm/@babel+types@7.17.0/node_modules/@babel/types/lib/ast-types/generated/index.js:1
export { createFileSessionStorage, unstable_createFileUploadHandler, unstable_createMemoryUploadHandler, unstable_parseMultipartFormData, } from "@remix-run/node";
^^^^^^

SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'
    at Object.compileFunction (node:vm:352:18)
    at wrapSafe (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1031:15)
    at Module._compile (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1065:27)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1153:10)
    at Module.load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:981:32)
    at Function.Module._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:822:12)
    at Module.require (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1005:19)
    at require (node:internal/modules/cjs/helpers:102:18)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/andres/code/opensource/unexpected-export/node_modules/.pnpm/@babel+types@7.17.0/node_modules/@babel/types/lib/index.js:629:19)
    at Module._compile (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1101:14)
```

### Additional information:
PNPM: `6.32.2`
NX: `13.8.4`
Node: `16.13.2`
Mac OS X: `Monterey 12.2`

## Theory
I think is related with two things. First is [jest doesn't support ES modules out of the box](https://jestjs.io/docs/ecmascript-modules) and second is that the way `pnpm` works looks like is giving Jest too much context. Why jest have access to those packages inside `node_nodules/.pnpm/...`? 

I tried another monorepo manager last week [rush](https://rushjs.io/) and I had the same issue. Also the fact that switching to another node manager like `yarn1` fix the problem make me suspect I'm doing something wrong when using `pnpm`.

comment.body: If it works with yarn1 and npm then it means that it will work with pnpm too, if you set the `node-linker` option to `hoisted`.

issue.title: `pnpm publish` produces different package contents than `npm publish`
issue.body:
### Verify latest release

- [X] I verified that the issue exists in the latest pnpm release

### pnpm version

8.7.0

### Which area(s) of pnpm are affected? (leave empty if unsure)

CLI

### Link to the code that reproduces this issue or a replay of the bug

_No response_

### Reproduction steps

Running `pnpm -r publish --access public --no-git-checks --dry-run` produces:

```
npm notice 
npm notice 📦  @my-company/my-package@0.0.6
npm notice === Tarball Contents === 
npm notice 782B   ./dist/index.cjs
npm notice 1.1kB  LICENSE         
npm notice 782B   dist/index.cjs  
npm notice 16.5kB dist/index.d.ts 
npm notice 846B   dist/index.js   
npm notice 1.3kB  package.json  
```

Running `npm publish --workspaces --access public --dry-run` produces:

```
npm notice 
npm notice 📦  @my-company/my-package@0.0.6
npm notice === Tarball Contents === 
npm notice 269B  README.md      
npm notice 1.3kB dist/index.cjs 
npm notice 2.7kB dist/index.d.ts
npm notice 1.6kB dist/index.js  
npm notice 1.3kB package.json 
```

### Describe the Bug

What seems rather odd is that there are slight differences in which files are included in the final package:

- The license file is included only when using `pnpm` (not explicitly included)
- The readme file is included only when using `npm` (not explicitly included)
- The `dist/index.cjs` file is included twice with slightly different paths when using `pnpm`: `./dist/index.cjs` and `dist/index.cjs`. This shouldn't affect the package contents, as both file paths refer to the same file.

### Expected Behavior

The package contents are the same for both tools. Also, the same file is only included once instead of two (or more) times.

### Which Node.js version are you using?

20.5.0

### Which operating systems have you used?

- [ ] macOS
- [ ] Windows
- [X] Linux

### If your OS is a Linux based, which one it is? (Include the version if relevant)

Arch

comment.body: We need to update `npm-packlist`. I am working on it.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +48,7 @@ export interface StrictInstallOptions {
   lockfileIncludeTarballUrl: boolean
   preferWorkspacePackages: boolean
   preserveWorkspaceProtocol: boolean
+  requiresbuildFromRegistry: boolean
comment.body:
This is very specific to npmjs, so I'd say use:
use-experimental-npmjs-files-index
